urls.title: Raw sewage breaches in UK rivers 10 times greater than watchdog estimates
urls.description: In 2020 there were 160 breaches of Environment Agency permits to release sewage into rivers, UCL professor tells MPs

tweets.text: It‚Äôs far worse than anyone imagined. Our rivers are little more than open sewers. Raw sewage breaches in UK rivers are 10 times greater than @EnvAgency estimates https://t.co/fURw4paunH

tweets.text: Yesterday I joined this joint operation between our @EnvAgency officers and @warkspolice - great partnership working ensuring waste crime doesn‚Äôt pay or blight communities - well worth the 0330 start! https://t.co/Kjdq4vzDS6

@curranjc @lauraepolicy @SaveLeaMarshes @EnvAgency Spot on James. We convicted farmers in Glasgow for major fish kills using Cypermethrin tests, following intensive incident-chasing and sampling. I doubt very much that biological sampling would‚Äôve brought convictions. Let‚Äôs not overegg the pudding, different tools for right jobs

entity.name: Good Morning Britain
entity.description: Good morning, Britain. Up early and need to catch up on the latest news, weather and sports? Then this weekday morning programme is for you, offering the latest information in such areas as entertainment, health and money. `Good Morning Britain' is the typical morning news and talk show. It features a number of presenters, correspondents and reporters covering what you should know to start your day before heading out the door.

tweets.text: @lauraepolicy @SaveLeaMarshes @EnvAgency Which @EnvAgency specific practices? It's a rather sweeping statement !  Yes - biological monitoring is preferable in many ways, but chemical sampling & analysis (of sediments/biota/effluents) has immense power to nail down pollutants and sources.

And fire services - air quality found to be not of a good enough quality for the breathing apparatus  - what?! @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency @BorisJohnson @MattHancock #stopthestink https://t.co/xKj83oyQJW
